title: A statue of civil rights leader Mary McLeod Bethune is getting a place in the US Capitol. She's replacing a Confederate general
description: A larger-than-life marble statue of civil rights pioneer Mary McLeod Bethune is replacing one of a Confederate general in the US Capitol's Statuary Hall.

title: Top conservative lawyers steer clear of Trump's latest legal fight
Biden admin announces plans for massive expansion of wind farms off US coasts
description: The Biden administration is planning to aggressively expand offshore wind energy capacity in the United States, potentially holding as many as seven new offshore lease sales by 2025.

title: Rolling Stones phase out popular hit 'Brown Sugar'
description: The Rolling Stones have retired their classic song "Brown Sugar," which begins with a slave narrative and sexualizes young Black women.

title: Top conservative lawyers steer clear of Trump's latest legal fight
description: • Analysis: Pressure on Jan. 6 panel ratchets up amid new explosion of Trump election lies

title: Most evacuation flights from Afghanistan this week have been canceled
description: Most evacuation flights scheduled to depart Afghanistan this week have been canceled, according to a State Department email sent to US citizens in the country on Monday that was reviewed by CNN.

title: Ex-aide to Bush issues dire warning about Trump
description: Michael Gerson, columnist and former aide to President George W. Bush, argues that US democracy is at risk if former President Donald Trump is re-elected with unified Republican control of the federal government.

title: Brazil's Bolsonaro says he will not be vaccinated against Covid-19
description: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said he decided not to get a Covid-19 vaccine, in an on-air interview with Jovem Pan radio on Tuesday night.

title: Paul McCartney says the Rolling Stones are 'a blues cover band'
description: in the latest installment of a friendly rivalry between two of the world's biggest music groups, Beatles legend Paul McCartney has dubbed the Rolling Stones "a blues cover band."

title: New findings a 'complete reversal' in understanding why Earth became hospitable to life and its 'twin' didn't
description: Venus may be a sweltering wasteland today, but scientists have questioned whether the planet was always so inhospitable. While previous studies suggested Venus might have once been covered in oceans, new research has found the opposite: Venus has likely never been able to support oceans.

title: Rising soccer star, 24, reveals cancer diagnosis
description: Wales international David Brooks has revealed he's been diagnosed with stage two Hodgkin Lymphoma.

title: Adele announces release date for new album
description: Adele has announced a release date for her much anticipated new album.

title: Actor's impersonation of Robin Williams leaves fans wanting whole film
description: Actor Jamie Costa is making waves online after posting a video to his YouTube channel, showing a scene featuring himself as Williams and Sarah Murphree as Pam Dawber on the set of "Mork & Mindy."

title: Relatives of Covid victims slam Boris Johnson after he was pictured painting on vacation
description: Relatives of Covid-19 victims have hit out at "deeply upsetting" images of Boris Johnson seen painting while on vacation -- just one day after his government was slated for its handling of the pandemic.

title: Europeans were enjoying blue cheese and beer 2,700 years ago, ancient poop shows
description: Iron Age Europeans enjoyed foods that are still part of our diet today -- like blue cheese and beer -- new research studying ancient poop has shown.

title: Europe on collision course with US over Venezuela elections
description: The European Union is running the risk of winding up its most important ally next month, after the bloc agreed to send a team to observe Venezuela's regional elections, set to take place on November 21.

title: Kenyan world record holder found dead following alleged stabbing
description: Kenyan long-distance runner Agnes Tirop, who represented her country at the recent Tokyo Olympics, has died aged 25, Athletics Kenya (AK) announced in a statement on Wednesday.

title: Vladimir Putin says Russia is not using energy as a weapon
description: President Vladimir Putin has rejected accusations that Russia is deliberately driving natural gas prices higher in Europe by withholding exports.

title: WhatsApp messages are being deleted by UK officials. Should that be allowed?
description: Should UK government officials be allowed to send each other "disappearing messages" on WhatsApp? A High Court judge has ruled that two campaign groups can pursue their case to end the practice.

title: Beanie Feldstein on playing and meeting Monica Lewinksy
description: Beanie Feldstein, who is playing Monica Lewinksy in the 'Impeachment: American Crime Story' speaks with CNN's Christiane Amanpour about why she took the role and meeting Lewinsky in real life.

title: Israel could be World Cup 2030 co-host
description: FIFA President Gianni Infantino has floated the prospect that Israel might co-host the World Cup in 2030, according to Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett.

title: Poland plans to spend over $400 million on wall on Belarus border
description: Poland plans to spend over 1.6 billion zlotys ($404 million) on building a wall on its border with Belarus, according to a draft bill lawmakers are due to discuss on Wednesday, in a bid to stem the flow of migrants trying to cross.

title: 'Jeopardy!' winner reveals 'boring' plans for $1.5M earnings after epic streak ends
description: "Jeopardy!" contestant Matt Amodio saw his 38-game winning streak come to an end, putting him behind only Ken Jennings on the list of most consecutive wins. CNN's John Berman talks to Amodio about his winning steak and what it was like to walk away with $1.5M.

title: How Italy's high-speed trains helped kill Alitalia
description: Over a decade ago, when Francesco Galietti had to take the train from his native Rome to Milan for work, he used to fly the nearly 400-mile route. Today, he takes the train.

title: Legendary hotel opens to non-guests for first time
description: Showers embellished with 24-carat gold tiles. Duvets filled with eiderdown harvested from abandoned duck nests in Iceland. Pillow menus. Thirty different types of marble. A ceiling made of 21,000 Swarovski crystals representing the Milky Way. These are just some of the luxuries that await at Dubai's Burj Al Arab, one of the world's most exclusive hotels.

title: The world's tallest living woman is a 24-year-old from Turkey
description: A 24-year-old Turkish woman who stands 215.16 centimeters (7 feet, 0.7 inches) tall has been confirmed as the world's tallest living woman by Guinness World Records.

title: How Jews and Arabs worked together to pull off an impossible rescue mission
description: An Israeli aid group, officials of the UAE and a Jewish financier -- an unusual mix of people have worked together and pulled off a rescue mission that helped 125 vulnerable Afghans flee the Taliban rule. CNN's Hadas Gold reports.

title: Analysis: With all eyes on Taiwan, tensions are building on another Chinese frontier: India
description: China's increased military activity in the Taiwan Strait may have grabbed all the headlines in recent weeks, but thousands of miles to the west, another simmering territorial dispute on the country's borders looks more likely to boil over first.

title: Dutch monarch could be in same-sex marriage, prime minister says
description: In the country that first legalized gay marriage, the Dutch crown princess has the right to marry a person of any gender without giving up her right to the throne, the Prime Minister of the Netherlands said on Tuesday.

title: Squid Game is Netflix's 'biggest ever' series launch
description: "Squid Game" — a fictional drama from South Korea — is Netflix's "biggest-ever series at launch," the streaming company exclusively told CNN on Tuesday.

title: Stunning underwater scene wins Wildlife Photographer of the Year competition
description: The winning images in this year's Wildlife Photographer of the Year competition have been released after a record-breaking number of entries were submitted, with a riveting underwater shot taking home the top prize.

title: It's time to talk about money with your tweens and teens. Here's how
description: Children are watching -- and it's not just behaviors like kindness and empathy that can make an impression.

title: Afghan artists destroy their work fearing Taliban retribution
description: Residents of Kabul can read the writing on the wall. "Don't trust the propaganda of the enemy" says one freshly painted sign.

title: Can the world learn from indigenous food systems, before they are lost?
description: Fabian Jimbijti sometimes walks three days to find food for his community. He treks across mountains to collect salt from a sacred spring deep in the jungle, wades into rivers to catch eels, and forages the forest floor for herbs and wild edibles.

title: Bodybuilding, boxing and fire: How Cassils pushes performance art to its extreme
description: Canadian artist Cassils has been set alight on stage, wrestled a 2,000-pound block of clay in the pitch dark and trained as a bodybuilder on a cocktail of steroids, raw eggs and protein.

title: Air New Zealand offering chance to get vaccinated on a plane
description: October 16 is being billed as Super Saturday in New Zealand, where the government is urging any eligible unvaccinated New Zealander to get their shot.

title: Coroner rules Gabby Petito died by strangulation. But these questions are left unanswered
description: There is now a clearer picture of what happened to Gabby Petito after a coroner ruled Tuesday that she died by strangulation. But many questions remain unanswered.

title: G20 pledges help for Afghan humanitarian crisis at special summit
description: The Group of 20 major economies is determined to tackle the humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan, even if it means having to coordinate efforts with the Taliban, Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi said on Tuesday after hosting an emergency summit.

title: Africa's last total monarchy faces daunting challenges
description: CNN's Larry Modowo speaks to Eswatini Prime Minister Cleopas Dlamini about the challenges that the country is facing.

title: They made signs, now they're making explosives: a resistance movement on the rise
description: CNN's Ivan Watson speaks to two men who turned against Myanmar's military regime amid a wave of popular outrage following the military coup that ousted the elected government eight months ago.

title: Amy Winehouse possessions hit the auction block
description: Nearly 800 of Amy Winehouse's belongings, including the short dress the late British singer wore in her final concert, are up for auction.

title: Fans around the world are taking up 'Squid Game' challenges
description: South Korean series 'Squid Game' has become the biggest hit in the history of Netflix, with the challenges featured in the drama also gaining popularity around the globe. CNN's Selina Wang reports.

title: They're trying to preserve Hong Kong's neon lights
description: From Hollywood blockbusters to Wong Kar-wai movies, neon signs have been an iconic representation of Hong Kong.

title: Pressure on January 6 panel ratchets up amid new explosion of Trump election lies
description: The House's US Capitol insurrectsion probe is fast turning into a race against time, up against Republican efforts to delay an accounting on ex-President Donald Trump's coup attempt after losing the 2020 election even as he preemptively begins undermining the next one.

title: 'Never seen anything like this': Experts worry about North Korea's latest weapon display
description: CNN's Brian Todd looks at a recent weapons display put on by Kim Jong Un that has analysts and experts concerned.

title: Peak oil is coming. That won't save the world
description: The shift to clean energy is sending the oil industry into decline. But the world needs a much more ambitious plan to save the climate and achieve net-zero emissions by 2050.

title: White House press secretary Jen Psaki mocks Ted Cruz for false claim
description: White House press secretary Jen Psaki mocked Sen. Ted Cruz (R-TX) after he falsely claimed Southwest Airlines was experiencing a shortage of employees because of vaccine mandates and President Joe Biden.

title: China to test thousands of Wuhan blood samples in Covid-19 probe
Here's why the once vaccine hesitant are changing their minds
description: There's a Herculean effort to ensure that the most vulnerable get inoculated across the US.

title: US officials reported Havana syndrome symptoms in Colombia
description: More than a dozen US officials who work at the US Embassy in Colombia and their family members have reported symptoms consistent with "Havana syndrome" in recent weeks, according to a US official and a source familiar with the situation.

title: Hasbro CEO Brian Goldner has died
description: Hasbro chairman and CEO Brian Goldner has died, according to the company. His death comes shortly after Hasbro announced he would take a leave of absence for cancer treatment.

title: Ousted Myanmar President says army tried to force him to resign hours before coup
description: Myanmar's deposed President testified on Tuesday that the military tried to force him to relinquish power hours before its February 1 coup, warning him he could be seriously harmed if he refused, according to his lawyer.

title: Art historians try to identify enslaved Black child in an 18th-century portrait
description: A year ago this month, when it was still closed to the public because of the pandemic, the Yale Center for British Art (YCBA) took a major step toward interrogating a controversial 18th-century group portrait in its collection centering on an early benefactor to the university, Elihu Yale.

title: His daughter was shot on live TV and the video keeps circling online. Hear what he wants done
description: Andy Parker, the father of Alison Parker who was killed in a gun attack in 2015 on live television, takes on Facebook over the video of her murder still circulating on their platform.

title: The global supply chain nightmare is about to get worse
description: Computer chip shortages. Epic port congestion. And a serious lack of truck drivers. The world's delicate supply chains are under extreme stress.
